locutie.beschrijving: A comprehensive exposition of the 'Lamb of God' motif across four biblical themes: the Conquering Lamb (Enoch/Revelation), the Sacrificial Lamb (Hebrews), the Passover Lamb (Exodus), and the Suffering Servant (Isaiah).
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: High. The preacher provides historical-critical and intertextual depth, moving from Jewish apocalyptic literature to the Akedah.

illocutie.beschrijving: Primarily asserting biblical-theological facts to correct modern ignorance, shifting to a concluding address that attempts to apply these facts to the hearer.
voorbeelden: The Latin name for this symbol is Agnus Dei.
First, they knew that a Messiah was expected.
It is your sin... that is taken away.

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: The hearer should 'behold' (see and believe) the efficacy of Christ's sacrifice and feel the weight of the 'Great Exchange'.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Explicitly mentioned at the end: 'We pray that Jesus Christ will make himself known.'

voorbeelden: The book of Revelation gives us a number of clues.
The myth of human moral progress died in Auschwitz.
In Jesus Christ, God has provided his own sacrifice.
Imagine yourself part of the whole company.
Let the church be first to step forward.
This seems very peculiar to us.
I have more than once been sneered at.
God... has promised us a completely recreated future.
He has appeared once for all... to put away sin.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are mostly quoted as past-tense biblical facts rather than present-tense speech acts from the preacher.

voorbeelden: It is your sin... that is taken away.
You have been snatched back from the very brink.
declaratieven.autoriteit: The authority is derived from the 'Word of God reaching out,' but the preacher waits until the final paragraph to exercise this.

indicatoren: Extensive historical explanation of Enoch and Jewish apocalypticism.
Lengthy quotes from Hebrews and Exodus used as evidence rather than address.
Talking about the 'Agnus Dei' in art and music history.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer becomes a student of biblical theology rather than a participant in a sacramental event until the very end.

missende_elementen: Present-tense sacramental address in the body of the sermon
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: Delayed encounter; the 'event' is postponed to the final 'Amen'.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strongly personal in the conclusion, but descriptive in the body.
voorbeelden: It is you who are 'washed in the blood of the Lamb'.

eerste_persoon.gebruik: Preacher as teacher/researcher ('My own informal polls').

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address concentrated in the final 200 words.
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: High in the conclusion ('It is you...').

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing 'the people of John's time', 'the Jews', 'the Lamb'.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: General theological truths about human nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the preaching event in the conclusion.

voorbeelden: The shift from 'The Lamb takes away sin' to 'It is your sin... that is taken away'.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is abrupt but powerful.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: Because God provided the lamb... behold and believe.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon functions primarily as a high-level theological lecture that successfully builds a foundation for a performative climax, but spends the majority of its time 'talking about' the text.

sterke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Analysis of the 'horned Lamb' in Enoch.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: Lengthy sections on art history and Victorian sentimentality.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: It becomes an event only in the final movement where the 'You' is addressed.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The preacher relies on the 'Word reaching out' but remains a lecturer for 80% of the text.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Yes, explicitly stated: 'It is the Word of God reaching out for you'.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: Yes, the preacher sees themselves as repeating the 'sum of all Christian preaching'.
tekstueel_bewijs: It is not the preacher that reaches out for you. It is the Word of God.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Implicitly, through the prayer for Christ to make himself known.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Yes, the effect (believing) is treated as a gift of the encounter.
tekstueel_bewijs: We pray that Jesus Christ will make himself known.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: Yes, the sermon is intended to be the 'Great Exchange' in verbal form.
tekstueel_bewijs: You have heard, tonight, how God has made the Great Exchange.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: Heavy reliance on 'to be' and 'to know' (Assertives); needs more 'to give' and 'to declare' (Commissives/Declaratives).

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The idea of a lamb slaughtered as a sin offering was as familiar to the people of Jesus' time as TV commercials are to us.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Just as the blood of the lamb once marked the doors of the terrified, tonight Christ marks your life with his own blood.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a historical comparison to a present-tense declarative act.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is buried under too much historical scaffolding.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Interweave the 'Toezegging' (Promise) into each historical section.
voorbeeldzinnen: This conquering Lamb does not just defeat ancient evil; he defeats your fear today.

adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Use 'You' earlier to bridge the gap between the biblical text and the hearer.
voorbeeldzinnen: When you hear 'Lamb of God', do not think of a painting; hear God's promise to you.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually good, though the indicative is overly historical.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Make the indicative more 'kerygmatic' (present-tense proclamation) and less 'historical' (past-tense information).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is theologically profound and reaches a powerful performative peak, but risks losing the hearer in the 'museum of biblical history' before the sacramental event occurs.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: Unlike SvT, which would focus on the preacher's 'self-revelation' or 'appeal', this analysis shows the preacher attempting to disappear so the 'Word' can act as a Declarative.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The focus is not on the 'persuasiveness' of the lamb imagery, but on whether the preacher successfully 'hands over' the promise (Commissives).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT reveals that the sermon's 'event-character' is concentrated entirely in the final paragraph, leaving the rest as 'constative preparation'.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High - functions as the pivot of the sermon.

kernzinnen_analyse.zin: The Latin name for this symbol is Agnus Dei.

appendices.notities: The preacher is clearly aware of the 'event' nature of preaching but spends a significant amount of time on 'Locutionary' groundwork due to perceived biblical illiteracy in the audience.
